org.activebpel.wsio.AeWsAddressingException

org.activebpel.rt.axis.bpel Root package for the Active Endpoints Runtime for Axis (rtaxis).

Uses of AeWsAddressingException in org.activebpel.rt.axis.bpel
 

Methods in org.activebpel.rt.axis.bpel that throw AeWsAddressingException
protected  boolean AeInvokeHandler.isWsaMandatory(IAeWebServiceEndpointReference aPartnerEndpoint, IAeWebServiceEndpointReference aMyEndpoint)
          Mandatory WSA information should be added automatically if 1. we have a ReplyTo address from the partner endpoint reference properties --OR-- 2. we have headers required for engine managed correlation in the default reply to ref props TODO: Use the 2006 WSA SOAP Binding spec to decide this in the future
 

Uses of AeWsAddressingException in org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.addressing
 

Methods in org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.addressing that throw AeWsAddressingException
 void IAeAddressingHeaders.addHeaderElement(org.w3c.dom.Element aElement)
          Adds a WS-Addressing header to this instance.
 void IAeAddressingHeaders.setReferenceProperties(java.util.List aElementList)
          Sets the reference properties for this instance.
 void AeAddressingHeaders.addHeaderElement(org.w3c.dom.Element aElement)
          Adds a WS-Addressing header element to this instance If the element is a WS-Addressing Header, the element will set the appropriate member variable Adding headers this way prevents accidentally duplicating an addressing header if someone adds, for example, a ReplyTo element to reference properties
 void AeAddressingHeaders.setReferenceProperties(java.util.List aElementList)
          Sets the list of additional headers to be included when serializing to a SOAP Envelope If the list contains any embedded WS-Addressing headers, these will be used to set the appropriate member value of this instance
